Line 1: Line 1: −
just go to australia and you will find gem and mike, two teens who have different personalities and different lifestyles. but if you look deeper into what the 10 month relationship has brought out in them then you will be farily suprised and in disbelief of what love can do. love in many ways is the best word that can be spoken in a relationship but on the other hand it can be the worst, when some one says the love you then what they mean (or what mike meant when he told gem) was that he believed that she was the one he could tell anything, the one he could trust with anything and the one he felt most natural around, also the one he felt affectionate about in many ways. Now that these two have been together so long things seem to be getting harder, as love takes its toll on things. such as when you love someone and they do something small it is mainly always blown out or propotion. if the love is real then by all means the two who are 'in love' will do anything to over come these problems. once the problem reaches its maximum then the couple has to sit down and work out what happens next. in some cases it is one of the two who makes the ultimate decision and in the case of gem and mike this will be the decision made on the 21st May 2006... mike can only wait and hope now...

{{otheruses}}
      +
[[Image:Love heart uidaodjsdsew.gif|200px|thumb|right|A [[cartoonish]] version of the [[Heart (symbol)|heart]], a frequent modern symbol of love.]]
  +
Love is an emotion of intense attraction to, care for, or identification with persons, place(s) or thing(s); a desire to be close to, move and construct its object. This can include love for one's self.
     
However, '''love''' has several different meanings in the [[English (language)|English]] language, from something that gives a little pleasure ("I loved that meal") to something that one would die for ([[patriotism]], [[pair-bonding]]). And in contrast to the definition at the top, frequently people use the verb "love" to indicate want or desire for themselves as opposed to for another. For example: "I love ice cream," or even "I love her/him," does not refer to desiring wellness for ice cream, and it may not refer to desiring wellness for her/him, but rather to the desire for ice cream or for her/him felt by the speaker. The word also frequently indicates elevated appreciation or admiration: "I love that artist." Love can describe an intense feeling of [[affection]], an [[emotion]] or an emotional state. In ordinary use, it usually refers to interpersonal love. As an experience usually felt by a person for another person, it is commonly considered impossible to describe. Dictionaries tend to define ''love'' as deep affection or fondness.<ref>''Oxford Illustrated American Dictionary'' (1998) + ''Merriam-Webster Collegiate Dictionary'' (2000).</ref> In colloquial use, according to polled opinion, the most favoured definitions of ''love'' include the words:<ref>[http://www.humanthermodynamics.com/RP2-Love.html '04 Poll of 250 Chicagoans] – Institute of Human Thermodynamics (Chicago)</ref>
